description: Works as a GP in a rural area –Gippsland
Lives with her husband, Frank, and has a 4-year-old cat, Albert

Has a 19-year-old daughter, Cassandra, living in Melbourne attending University of Melbourne, and a 17-year-old son named Jonathon who works as a part-time receptionist at the clinic who attends the local high school
Loves baking and hiking with friends
High-quality information on health topics to use in her research on the health and wellbeing of Indigenous communities
Access to relevant cultural information associated with the health of Aboriginals and Torres Strait Islander people
Access to data tracking progressof the health &wellbeing of Indigenous people in her area
Provide culturally respectful health service to her patients•
Have loyal Indigenous patients
Have a positive impact on the wellbeing of Indigenous people in her area
Years of experience with desktop applications related to her work
Web browsing on a daily basis
Recently moved from New Zealand
Works as Civil Law Solicitor at a small law firm
Hobbies include photography and writing travel blogs and learning about different cultures and countries
Aspires to “do her own thing” and is saving to open her own consulting business one day
Flats in central Sydney with three other young professionals
Lara needs to be aware of all the issues that impact her clientele, specifically the issues faced by indigenous families and individuals
Lara needs to know about significant indigenous-rights cases that have appeared before the cour
Lara needs to understand the demographics of the clientele that live in her region
Lara wants to undertake pro-bono work once every two weeks
Lara wants to help and wants to take active participation in reducing racism and empowering women
Very active on social media platforms; constantly shares her creative work with her 4k followers
Lara is good at analysing case facts but sifting through numerical data is not her expertise
